alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Eastern Rensselaer; Eastern Schenectady; Northern Saratoga; Northern Washington; Southeast Warren; Southern Saratoga; Southern Washington; Western Rensselaer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 9:59PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A period of snow and sleet this evening...changing to a mix of rain and freezing rain around or just after midnight... Snow and sleet continues over the Capital Region, Lake George and Saratoga Region, occasionally moderate at times. Less than an inch of additional snow is expected before changing to sleet and rain around or after midnight. Totals of 1 to 3 inches of snow are expected, especially on grassy surfaces and untreated surfaces. Precipitation will change to sleet and rain around midnight. There could also be a brief period of freezing rain before changing to rain around midnight as temperatures rise into the mid 30s. Motorists are advised to slow down and allow extra distance between yourself and others.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Albany; Eastern Rensselaer; Eastern Schenectady; Northern Saratoga; Northern Washington; Southeast Warren; Southern Saratoga; Southern Washington; Western Rensselaer
